head.title: July 23-29; Germany Pays for a Call

hedline.hl1: July 23-29; Germany Pays for a Call

block.p: Germany's largest telephone company, Deutsche Telekom, entered the American cellular telephone market by buying the VoiceStream Wireless Corporation, for $50.7 billion. The deal caught the attention of more than two dozen legislators in Washington, who have written to the chairman of the Federal Communications Commission seeking to block the acquisition because Deutsche Telekom's majority shareholder is the German government.

Germany's largest telephone company, Deutsche Telekom, entered the American cellular telephone market by buying the VoiceStream Wireless Corporation, for $50.7 billion. The deal caught the attention of more than two dozen legislators in Washington, who have written to the chairman of the Federal Communications Commission seeking to block the acquisition because Deutsche Telekom's majority shareholder is the German government.
